review.review_text: Buddakan is always full. You have to go there to understand why. The atmosphere, the excellent Asian food and the setting of the place are mesmerizing. Definitely worth the visit while you're in the Big Apple
I am going there with my friends and family on my birthday.We ordered a cake and enjoyed . We took rooms for night stay somewhere. The  party was great .The food is good and there services also.

The restaurant is dimly light establishing the mood for a loving dinner. Being that my boyfriend and I were enjoying an anniversary it was fantastic. Our host Jessie was well qualified in the menu and ingredients. He made great guidelines. He discussed every dish as it was delivered out and answered any questions we had with ease.

Incredible food! Absolutely everything was delicious. Served quite quickly. Highly recommend the bread pudding for dessert. Very prompt and friendly service. Huge building with nice dim lit decor. Great cocktails too. What more could you want?!

Absolutely amazing!  The only reason not giving 5 is, we had to wait at the bar for half an hour until they managed to take us to our seat!  However everything afterwards was amazing. Our waiter Mike, was lovely and made some seriously good recommendations.  We had  edamame dimsum, which was the best dimsum i have ever had.  Chilly Rock shrimp, very delicious and crispy.  Sesame shrimp tost, a bit too greasy but tasty.  For the mains, black cod' perfectly cooked, right amount of sweetness and th...
There had ideal food, fantastic support and perfect organization.I and my friends were seated at the significantly end the restaurant in the booth with a view of the entire room.

I love Le Bernardin.... !We were choosing between a lunch at Le Bernardin or Jean-Georges and ultimately settled on the former, based on one of S’s good friends’ suggestions (and the fact that it’s a lot cheaper). There is a dress code, and “gentlemen” were expected to wear a coat – of course, S didn’t bring a coat there, but fortunately they provided him with one for the meal.

For the price, I was fairly underwhelmed. The flavor profiles were good but nothing blew me away. The service was subpar too for an evening that cost approximately $1k for a meal for 4 people. Decor was a little on the dated side as well. My expectations were very high considering it is an Eric Ripert restaurant but it was just 'meh' all around.
I like Napkin Burger a lot . The restaurant is good .The staff member of  five  Napkin Burger is good .They provides their best services of every individuals.
Si buscas unas buenas hamburguesas este es el lugar que tienes que visitar en NYC. Un bar/restaurante, con mucha onda y sabores a otro nivel.
Showed up at 6:30 on Friday and walked into a table for two.  Amazing burgers, quick service, delicious boozy shake.  Couldn't be happier with our dinner.
Probably the best hamburger in New York. Very delicious with friendly staff. If you visit NYC, it's mandatory to have one. .. place having simple but very good interiors serving some niche dishes
Amazing atmosphere and Food . Just extremely busy on weekends and expect a wait but it's worth it . I go regularly and take my guests from out of town and all like it .

When I was in NYC, some ladies recommended this place.  I was not disappointed.  It was such a beautifully decorated place.  I felt like was transported out of the USA.  The service was great and they helped my son find things that he would like on the menu.  He doesn't care for (right now) foreign food.  We loved our dining experience.  It was such a great place to go.  I found everything that we had to be fresh and tasty.

Take a trip to Southeast Asia by eating at Jean-George Vongerichten’s Spice Market. The cuisine here  is inspired by regional street food combined with Vongerichten’s distinctive touch. The interiors are resplendent and definitely make you feel like you are in some exotic locale of Asia. There are decorative pagodas and arches that adorn the enormous space and a grand staircase that leads to the hopping bar area downstairs. All of this makes for a really great spot to hang out at where one i...
Very nice place for a trendy dinner. As you can imagine the good is spicy but it's very good to see and taste. Must try cocktails, fantastic margarita. Highly recommended
Nice concept with beatiful seating. I tried a vegetarian burger with mushroom and the raste was delicious. Excelent place in Hell's Kitchen.

They definitely serve up a good burger and Shack-o-dog hotdog ! One thing that fell short (and this is completely out of utter enjoyment) is how much smaller the burgers are than expected. I'll say no more but Shake shack is definitely one that needs be ticked off on your list of things to try here in NYC 👌
Shake Shack is extremely active. Expect hang on lines exterior their door. Don't let that mislead you although, the line moves pretty quick.

Old school steakhouse next to the Williamsburg bridge. The staff plays the park, and it's a very good meal that brings the historical aspect of NY into play. The steak for 2 is really good and filling, and love the mash potatoes and creamy spinach. Top it off with scotch and it's a good evening all around.

Ordered:  # USDA Prime Beef Steak for 3 # Luger's Sizzling Bacon, 2 extra thick slices # Luger's Special German Fried Potatoes  # Fresh Broccoli   No question asked! One of The best steak in the world. Their accolades and awards speak for themselves.   The steak perfectly cooked. Delicious to the bone. Their extra thick bacon sent me to bacon heaven.   Delicious...delicious...delicious... 1000% Satisfaction guaranteed. Just remember to make your reservation as early as possible when you already ...

This is awesome dinner to take the yesterday and this services is so good for the dinner I go to this restaurant and have taken dinner. It is  so good and i enjoy take of the dinner i like this services.
